src.visualization package¶

Submodules¶

src.visualization.visualize module¶

src.visualization.visualize.accuracy(labels, pred)¶

compute the accuracy for our model

this function computes the accuracy given the labels and the predictions. it simply sums the number of labels that corresponds to the prediction and divids it by the length of labels

labelspandas.core.series.Series

the correct labels of our data

prednumpy.ndarray

the labels that we predicted

accfloat

the accuracy of the predictions

correctint

the number of correct predictions

incorrectint

the number of incorrect predictions

src.visualization.visualize.dsp(data, rows=10, columns=None)¶

displays the data

this function increases the limit of rows and columns that can be displayed. It is useful in a jupyter notebook to display all data at once. once the data is displayed, the limit of rows and columns is reduced again.

datapandas.DataFrame

the data we want to display

rowsint

the limit of rows we want to display

columnsint

the limit of columns we want to display

src.visualization.visualize.get_confusion_matrix(classifier, x_test, y_test, save_fig=False, savefile_name='', path='../reports/figures/')¶

gives the objects allowing to display the normalized and unnormalized confusion matrix

this function uses the plot_confusion_matrix from sklearn.metrics

classifierestimat or estimator instance

the classifier from wich we want the confusion matrix

x_testpandas.core.frame.DataFrame

the test set

y_testpandas.core.series.Series

the test labels

save_figbool

save the created figure if save_fig is true

savefile_namestring

the path where we want to save the figure

fig1matplotlib.figure.Figure

the normalized confusion matrix

axmatplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot

the axe for the normalized matrix

fig2matplotlib.figure.Figure

the unnormalized confusion matrix

ax2matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot

the axe for the unnormalized matrix

src.visualization.visualize.memory(df)¶

give the memory usage

this function gives the memory used of a dataframe in Mb.

dfpandas.DataFrame

the data we want to know the memory used

float

the memory used in Mb
